revision.revremark: Added Board and Ports panes, manual entry, still experimental

Use compositeVal type values (ports 1-5 for now), updated decoder schema, add LocoServo, add LocoIO (PIC) versions up to 1.54, show only show supported options by model (note VersionID is not stored in CV7 of LocoIO), Opcode (only for port 1 for now)

Changed address field labels hi/lo to function like 81/1 entry Use compositeVal type values (ports 1-16), add LocoBooster, Opcode1 and Opcode2 for ports 1-16, tested on actual hardware (read only), correct triple mask to store sensor address, LocoRCD(2) experimental

variable.label: PIC Version:
Versione PIC:
Version PIC:
PIC Version:
PIC-versie:
variable.tooltip: Open the LocoNet Monitor to confirm the actual firmware version number (shown after you click Read Full Sheet)

variable.label: Blink Rate:
Blinkgeschw.:
Knippertempo:
variable.tooltip: Choose from 0=none to 15=fast

variable.label: Detection Off Delay:
Abmeldungsverzögerung:
Blokdetectievertraging:
variable.tooltip: Choose from 0=none to 126 (~6,3 sec), 50ms per step

variable.label: Light Intensity:
Helligkeit:
Lichtintensiteit:
variable.tooltip: Choose from 0=dim to 14=bright

variable.label: All Block Detection ports Active High:
variable.tooltip: Default: unselected = Active Low

variable.label: Board Port type:
Anschlussart:
Type poorten:
variable.tooltip: How the ports on this board should operate

variable.label: Servo type:
Servotyp:
Type Servo's:
variable.tooltip: How servo ports 5-12 on this board should operate

variable.label: I/O:
variable.tooltip: What is connected to the board J4 connector? See LocoRCD2 manual.

variable.label: Code for buttons:
variable.tooltip: Button sends alternating or fixed code, default: fixed

variable.label: Port Refresh:
variable.tooltip: Refresh Ports, default: unselected = off

Sonderfunktion Anschlüsse 1-4:

label.text: WARNING: LocoIO board main address is incorrectly set to 80, reserved value for LocoBuffer. Please correct on tab Basic.
ACHTUNG: LocoIO Moduladresse 80 nicht gültig. Wert reserviert für LocoBuffer. Bitte sofort ändern.
WAARSCHUWING: LocoIO hoofdadres is foutief ingesteld op 80, dit adres is gereserveerd voor LocoBuffer. Direct verbeteren.

Max port address: 2048 (7 x 128 + 127 + 1). Checkbox "o" for Detector style address.
Use the Mode combo boxes to define the port operation mode, autofilling the Config and Value2 fields.

Hoogste poortadres: 2048 (7 x 128 + 127 + 1). Aankruisvak "o" for Detector adres.
Selecteer in de keuzelijst het type poort. Dit vult de Config- en Value2-velden.
d'Information importante sur les Modules LocoIO HDL
JMRI 4.21.2 or later is required to use this definition.
JMRI 4.21.2 oder neuer erforderlich für diese Decoderdefinition.
JMRI 4.21.2 ou plus nouveau est réquis pour útiliser cette Definition Décodeur.
Vereist JMRI 4.21.1 of later met deze definitie.

SV Programming Ops Mode addressing (LOCONETSV1MODE), Read & Write.


You have to select your PIC version and model when creating a roster entry.
Replace the DCC Address suggested by a reasonal low addres like "81" (default, translates to 81/1)
Save and close the decoder Roster entry and reopen from the Roster using "Programming On Main".

SV-Programmierung auf dem Hauptgleis (LOCONETSV1MODE), Lesen und Schreiben.


Handmässiger Modell- u. Versionsauswahl erforderlich bei Neueintrag. Vorgeschlagene Adresse ersetzen von einen gültigen Wert wie "81" (Modul 81/1 = Werkseinstellung).

SV's Programmeren via POM (LOCONETSV1MODE), Lezen & Schrijven.


Kies handmatig het type en PIC-versie bij het aanmaken van een Loc-definitie.
Vervang het ingevulde DCC adres door een normaal getal bijv. "81" (standaard adres, 81/1).
Bewaar en sluit de Decoder en open in de Loklijst met "Programmeren via POM")

As an alternative for the HDL Windows LocoIO Config program, follow these steps:

Be careful to first disconnect all other LocoIO devices before changing a board's (sub)address (Broadcast).

Step 1: Connect power and LocoNet to the unit.
Step 2: You can now modify the CVs using CV byte or CV bit programming.
Step 3: Set desired options and click "Write to decoder".
Step 4: Your modifications have been saved and the decoder module is ready for use.
